common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS getting stuck during boot-up or failing to launch, particularly on macOS and older Windows systems. This was often linked to core dependencies, data migration, or hardware requirements. Proposed solutions included reinstalling Windows, updating to the latest PiecesOS version, closing and reopening the app, and providing logs for debugging. The issue was largely resolved in subsequent updates.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of the Issue Discussion:

**Problem:** Users were experiencing issues with PiecesOS not fully starting on both Windows and macOS.

**Key Points:**

* **Windows:** The issue seemed to be related to a major data migration from a previous stack and the processor age (older than 2015). 
* **macOS:** The issue manifested with PiecesOS getting stuck at step 1 in the boot-up process.
* **Solutions:**
    * **Windows:** Users were advised to reinstall Windows with the latest version, try different builds of PiecesOS, and remove the com.pieces.os directory if it was located within their OneDrive/Documents folder.
    * **macOS:** Users were advised to simply close and re-open the app.

**Outcome:**

* **Windows:** The issue appears to be resolved for most users who followed the provided solutions.
* **macOS:** The immediate fix of closing and re-opening the app worked for the user who reported the issue. However, a patch was mentioned that would prevent this hanging altogether in the future.

**Additional Information:**

* The team at Pieces is actively working on resolving these issues and improving the overall user experience.
* Users can expect a new patch for the desktop app (3.3.8) to be released soon.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i had no issues with it in the begining but now when i try to open it now i encounter this error message 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e929cf56-d8a1-4185-8167-867ede2048e7)
## GitHub Conversation Summary: PiecesOS Taking a While to Boot

**Original Issue:**

* C2mokete reported PiecesOS taking a long time to boot.
* The Pieces support bot suggested related issues and resources.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested trying the latest release (PiecesOS 11.1.2).

**Current Status:**

* Mark-at-pieces closed the issue assuming the problem was resolved with the new release.

**Outcome:**

* Unknown, as C2mokete didn't provide further feedback.

**Key Points:**

* The Pieces bot was helpful in providing initial support and suggesting relevant resources.
* Mark-at-pieces offered a potential solution by recommending the latest release.
* More information is needed from C2mokete to confirm if the issue was resolved.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* `DevWizard24` reported an issue with Pieces failing to launch.
* `GetReal444` experienced the same issue and suggested attaching logs.
* `mark-at-pieces` confirmed known issues with hardware requirements in Pieces 11.1.1 and requested logs for troubleshooting.
* `tsavo-at-pieces` linked the issue to #625 and mentioned an upcoming release to fix the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces 11.1.1 had stricter hardware requirements than initially thought, causing launch issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Collecting logs from affected users for diagnosis.
* Releasing a patch to address the hardware requirement issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was resolved in Pieces 11.1.2.
* `mark-at-pieces` closed the issue after confirmation from `DevWizard24`.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to missing AVX2 support
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on Ubuntu, macOS, and Windows after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a dependency on AVX2 instructions not supported by some older CPUs. The Pieces team promptly released version 11.1.2, removing the AVX2 requirement and resolving the launch issue for affected users.

related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @Rohit0072 is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces app.

**Problems Identified:**

* App unresponsiveness
* Booting issues

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team provided related issues with potential solutions.
* A link to the Pieces team member's calendar and email was provided.
* A new release (11.1.2) with a potential fix was released.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is asked to update to the latest version and report back.
* The issue is closed, but can be reopened if needed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is related to other reported issues (#620, #624, #625).
* The Pieces team is actively working on a solution.

## Key Takeaways:

* The Pieces team is aware of the user's issue and is working to resolve it.
* The user is encouraged to update to the latest version and report back.
* If the issue persists, the user can reopen the issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on their macOS system.
* Pieces Support Bot automatically triaged the issue and directed the user to relevant resources.
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and confirmed they were working on a solution.
* The team identified the problem as CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch requiring AVX2 support, which wasn't available on user's CPU.
* A fix was implemented in version 11.1.2 with AVX2 support removed.

**Solutions:**

* Pieces team released version 11.1.2 with the fix.

**Outcomes:**

* User confirmed the issue was resolved with the update.

**Current Status:**

* Issue is closed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The team communicated effectively with the user throughout the process.
* The fix was implemented quickly and effectively.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Conversation Summary:

**Problem:**

The user (@GetReal444) experienced an error when booting up the Pieces application. 

**Key details of the issue:**
* Error occurred during initialization.
* AVX2 not supported on user's processor.

**Support Response:**

* Suggested additional information and troubleshooting steps.

**Solution Implemented:**

* Pieces team identified a hardware-related issue affecting a wider group of users.
* Developed and released a patch within 48 hours.

**Current Status:**

* User confirmed the problem is now resolved after updating to version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS.

**Additional Notes:**
* Pieces continues to work on a more permanent solution to address the underlying hardware requirement for the database service.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Crashing or Not Launching on macOS
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS crashing on launch or taking a long time to boot, particularly after updating to version 11.1.1. The issue was linked to CPU architecture incompatibility and a fix was released in version 11.1.2. Users experiencing this issue are advised to update to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary **Key Points Raised:** * The issue is resolved. **Problems Identified:** * No specific problems were identified in the conversation. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * No solutions were proposed or implemented, as the issue was already resolved. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is closed and marked as resolved. **Additional Notes:** * The conversation is very brief and provides limited information.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to connect to cloud services or utilize local LLMs. This might be due to firewall/network configurations, hardware requirements, or software bugs. Solutions include checking network settings, updating PiecesOS, and providing logs for debugging.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Rohan Rathi reported issues with both cloud service requests and local model usage in PiecesOS. 

**Key Points:**

* Rohan is experiencing difficulties making requests to cloud services and using local models.
* The first image provided by Rohan shows the error message.
* Mark, from the Pieces team, suspects a firewall or network configuration issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Rohan is unable to utilize both cloud services and local models in PiecesOS.
* The exact cause of the issue is unknown, but a firewall or network configuration is suspected.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark requested Rohan to share logs for com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd located at c://Users/{USER}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs.
* Mark offered to assist with real-time debugging via a calendar link provided.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated.
* Mark awaits Rohan's response with the requested logs. 
* Real-time debugging session is offered as an alternative solution.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* AmanSingh766 is experiencing an error while trying to download local LLMs.
* The error message is "Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress".

**Problems Identified:**

* Unable to download local LLMs.
* This is likely due to a connection issue or incomplete header.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested support logs from AmanSingh766.
* They also asked if the user is able to download any local LLMs or if the error occurs every time.
* Mark-at-pieces informed AmanSingh766 that the issue should be resolved in version 11.1.2 and asked them to reopen the issue if the problem persists.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear whether the issue has been resolved or not. 
* AmanSingh766 has not responded to the last comment from mark-at-pieces.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be similar to other reported issues about being unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.
* Mark-at-pieces provided helpful resources for troubleshooting and further assistance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* `DevWizard24` reported an issue with Pieces failing to launch.
* `GetReal444` experienced the same issue and suggested attaching logs.
* `mark-at-pieces` confirmed known issues with hardware requirements in Pieces 11.1.1 and requested logs for troubleshooting.
* `tsavo-at-pieces` linked the issue to #625 and mentioned an upcoming release to fix the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces 11.1.1 had stricter hardware requirements than initially thought, causing launch issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Collecting logs from affected users for diagnosis.
* Releasing a patch to address the hardware requirement issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was resolved in Pieces 11.1.2.
* `mark-at-pieces` closed the issue after confirmation from `DevWizard24`.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS launch issues:** Focus on addressing the root causes of boot-up failures and crashes, particularly those related to hardware requirements, CPU compatibility (AVX2 support), and core dependencies.

**Improve communication around hardware requirements:** Clearly communicate minimum and recommended hardware specifications for PiecesOS, ensuring users are aware of potential compatibility issues before upgrading.

**Enhance error messaging and logging:** Provide more informative error messages to users when launch failures occur, including specific details about the issue and potential solutions. Improve logging mechanisms to capture more detailed information for faster debugging.

**Develop a comprehensive troubleshooting guide:** Create a dedicated section in the PiecesOS documentation for troubleshooting launch and connectivity issues, covering common problems, solutions, and FAQs.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for developers:** Given the specific issues reported with "Pieces for Developers," explore creating a dedicated support channel or forum to address the unique needs of this user group.
